title: WOSS - facts, objectives and current results

author: Vlado Stankovski, Faculty of Computer and Information Science, University of Ljubljana

segmentation: I would just like to introduce.
The mosaic workshop.
Actually it's a mosaic supported workshop, but its fourth workshop in a row of workshops called Workshop on Software Services.
So this was an activity that was first started by European project funded, that Dana Professor Dana Petcu was coordinating in Romania and this project actually invited quite a lot of.
People from mainly from the new European Member States but also from other countries too.
Gaging very lively debate on the future of software services and there were quite a lot of quality presentations in this first three workshops.
So the first one was holding Tim Ishwara in 2010 in conjunction with the conference that is fairly organized in Romania.
It's a big Romanian conference and the second one two in 2011, while the Third Workshop was organized in connection to the fat Fat SIS conference.
I apologize, there is a mistake in this light.
In stretching Poland in 2011.
So Becauses first 3 the idea of this series of workshops was that the researchers working in the area of software services in the new Member States come to know each other.
'cause it is a common observation that projects usually of.
Partners or consortia submitted in this area and also another ICT areas from new Member States do not get enough attention, as do projects from Western European countries.
So the common idea here is that to find the strength, the strength in software services and to be able to.
Probably engage in joint research activities of course.
Also in connection to.
Go to the old Member States of the European Union, so that's basically the ideas of the workshop.
But I hope that this is not going to be the last one, but this idea would survive and will continue, so this time, as I say, it's supported by the Mosaic Pro.
Checked and we had the program committee we received about.
There's some number of contributions.
I'm happy that we have presenters from also other countries, meaning we have from Estonia professor on Apple from Poland, Professor Charge Channel and Donna is here too.
So this is.
Nice center, I hope that you are going to to enjoy the selected papers at this workshop.
And of course I would also like to invite you and actually everybody who is interested after the workshop we're going to.
We're organizing a special issue of the Slovenian Journal.
Actually, it's an International Journal, but is edited in Slovenia.
It's called Informatica, so we have a deadline for that until.
The December 15th so feel free to submit your works and this stop.
This special issue is.

On the topic of innovative gritton cloud applications, so we do not want to hear much about the lower the technical aspects of the of the middleware solutions and so on, but we want to see some success stories of applications that have been built by using cloud and grid technology and.
That's basically the idea of this special issue, so thank you.
